label: Structure Preparation
description: Clean/repair PDBs, add missing atoms/residues, standardize formats and protonation to produce analysis-ready receptor and peptide structures.

defaultInputs.name: Receptor Source
defaultInputs.tooltip: PDB file, AlphaFold model, or experimental structure for the receptor. Can be a filepath or accession ID.

defaultInputs.name: Ligand/Peptide Source
defaultInputs.tooltip: PDB file or amino acid sequence string for the ligand peptide.

defaultOutputs.name: Cleaned Receptor
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Cleaned and prepared receptor structure (PDB format).

defaultOutputs.name: Cleaned Ligand
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Cleaned and prepared ligand structure (PDB format).

configSchema.label: Receptor Source Type
configSchema.tooltip: Type of receptor source: upload PDB file, use AlphaFold prediction, or fetch experimental structure.

configSchema.label: Upload PDB File
configSchema.tooltip: Upload a PDB file containing protein names and sequences.

configSchema.label: Ligand Source Type
configSchema.tooltip: Type of ligand/peptide source: upload PDB file or provide amino acid sequence.

configSchema.label: Upload PDB File
configSchema.tooltip: Upload a PDB file containing protein names and sequences.

configSchema.label: Desired pH
configSchema.tooltip: Target pH for protonation state prediction (e.g., 7.4 for physiological conditions).

configSchema.label: Preparation Tool
configSchema.tooltip: Tool to use for structure preparation. PDBFixer is recommended for most cases.

configSchema.label: Fix Missing Residues
configSchema.tooltip: Attempt to model and add missing residues in the structure.

configSchema.label: Add Hydrogens
configSchema.tooltip: Add hydrogen atoms to the structure based on pH-dependent protonation states.

configSchema.label: Force Field
configSchema.tooltip: Force field to use for parameterization and hydrogen placement.

configSchema.label: Repair Mode
configSchema.tooltip: Minimal: only fix critical issues. Aggressive: attempt to fix all detected problems.

configSchema.label: Mutations (Optional)
configSchema.tooltip: Optional list of mutations to apply, in format: ChainResidueNewAA (e.g., A123G means chain A, residue 123, mutate to Glycine).

configSchema.label: Remove Chains (Optional)
configSchema.tooltip: Optional list of chain IDs to remove from the structure.

configSchema.label: Finding the pocket region?
configSchema.tooltip: Whether to detect and analyze binding pocket regions in the predicted structure.

configSchema.label: Choose model to predict pocket
configSchema.tooltip: Select the pocket prediction model. fpocket is fast and open-source, SiteMap provides detailed druggability analysis.
